forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Light Rain then Slight Chance Rain Showers
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 10pm, then a slight chance of rain showers. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 52. Southwest wind 2 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 55 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 2 to 13 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As evening unfurls upon Downtown San Francisco, the air is imbued with a gentle chill, whispering of rain that won't quite take hold until later. The sky hangs mostly obscured, a blanket of clouds softening the city’s contours and dimming the brilliance of urban lights. Tonight, a stray shower may dance through the streets, though the likelihood remains slight, teasing our senses with just a hint of moisture that evaporates before leaving its mark. With temperatures settling around a cool 52 degrees, a light wind stirs at 2 to 13 mph, sweeping in from the southwest, urging you to consider an extra layer as you step out.

Tomorrow promises a more substantial turn as rain showers take center stage. A predominantly cloudy canvas will yield to moments of brightness, inviting a fleeting glimpse of the sun, only to retreat into the embrace of gray. Expect the day to cool to around 55, squeezing the last remnants of warmth from the afternoon. As you prepare for the day ahead, honor the fluidity of this weather—layers are key. A well-chosen light raincoat will serve you well, paired with a comfortable pair of shoes suited for trickier footing on the wet pavement. While the forecast may not promise ideal conditions for a stroll along the bay, it is well-suited for cozying up in a local café or unwinding with a good book indoors, where you can let the rhythmic sound of rain create a soothing backdrop for an evening well spent.
